title: Updates
content:
To Mozilla Management_Please stop the constant updates>Why do we have to update constantly? ie: SteveKessler SteveKessler 11/20/14, 3:27 PM

We run a very nice internet business and 5 computers keep it running strong however we are continuing to update almost weekly. It has become a hassle to use Firefox. When we first started using Firefox years ago we might get an update 2 times a year now it appears to be 2 times a month. Please let us know why and if there is something we can do to change this. Updating and make unnecessary changes is very costly to our business and if it continues we may have to change browsers. We love Firefox but the updates must stop be so frequent. We do not have the time to keep updating nor do we want any computer updating without someone watching it. We do not want automated updates. On update was the worst when you made all the unnecessary changes. It took me all day to all 5 computers to look alike so everyone could use them no matter where they work. Please consider yourself a top browser and not a fly by night. This is a professional company so please act like it, walk like and turn this around. I am wondering if someone from Microsoft has started to help you?

SteveKessler SteveKessler Question owner 11/20/14, 4:22 PM

Two different answers to one question. I am asking why does Firefox constantly make updates? Why not leave everything alone? I understand if it is necessary but about 95% of the changes are b/c someone thinks they are helping. It is broken so please stop updating. If there needs to be an update due to hacker, i.e. then okay but all these other updates is not making it any better. People think if we make this change it will help others when all it does is make us keep updating and we do not use the new idea. We just want a fast browser without the gimmicks. Please consider that you already had a great browser and leave it alone.

SteveKessler SteveKessler Question owner 11/20/14, 6:56 PM

We're not interested in making changes when nothing is broken. You had Notice the word HAD the best browser on the internet! Now it is another browser competition for what? Just leave it alone. It does not need unnecessary upgrades. Making changes to make changes is not improvement. Keep it up and you will run off everyone. I know more about this than you think. Worked 35 years in this industry and know more than most will ever learn. I know if you keep changing just to change it will break down and you will not get the people back. You are not justifying the means and customers are very finicky. You are very close to losing it all. Too many people trying to show they know something without counting the cost.
creator: jeffreyson

title: Restricting Extensions to Specific Domains
content:
Many extensions ask for access to your entire browsing activity. While many extensions claim they are not doing so, this is not a technical restriction, but a policy restriction of their own.

In Chrome, there is a option within the browser to restrict extensions to operate within certain domains. For example, you could say that Honey is only allowed to run on *.amazon.com domains.

Is there a way to configure this option within FireFox? If not, what's the best way to request this feature be added? There are a number of extensions like Honey that are helpful for ecommerce and product research, but I want to provide a technical restriction to what data they can collect from the browser by restricting them to specific domains.

Thanks! Moose
creator: firefox1267

title: Certifications issues causing youtube to not work properly
content:
Hello, i was unable to access Google and YouTube due to "Error code: SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER", i could still access Gmail and drive but those two would not budge, i was still able to access them trough Chrome tough.

I did not have any anti-virus installed, did install malwarebytes for a moment, did a scan and uninstalled it, did not do anything. Turned off windows defender and nothing happened. I did have glasswire installed so uninstalled that as well and nothing happened.

After researching a bit more i found a solution where a guy imported the required certificate from another browser so i did the same. The certificate from both these websites was "DigiCert Global Root G1A" and it was present in Chrome but it was missing in Firefox(In case its relevant), and afterward i got access to both these websites however YouTube stopped working properly. The sidebar on the main site does not show any content( https://prnt.sc/109dtjv ), the comment section wont load and also when i click on my profile it wont load as well ( https://prnt.sc/109dux1 ). As far as i am aware those are the only issues i am facing, the videos load with no problem. Everything is working properly on Chrome so i will assume its not YouTube. I tried starting in incognito mode and safe mode, the issue is still there. So what im currently assuming is that maybe i should not have imported a certificate from another browser but i could be wrong so any help would be appreciated.


TL:DR: Imported certificate from another browser to fix "Error code: SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER", now YouTube wont load the sidebar, comment section and myprofile dropdown menu.
creator: Foximite

title: Firefox NIGHTLY 88.0a1 64bit slow freezing..
content:
Firefox NIGHTLY 88.0a1 64bit

Operating system windows 7 64bit Intel Xeon 1230v3 RAM 32gb GeForce 970 wd blue ssd 500gb

One day, Nightly began to slow down.

Creating 20 new tabs didn't slow it down, but now creating 4 new tabs freezes or doesn't respond.

Even if you turn off hardware acceleration, turn off additional functions, or turn off unnecessary functions among experimental functions, it will only speed up for a while.

Over time, it stops again or stops responding.

Since it is a problem with the computer, there is no change even if I run it again after cleaning the registry and other optimizations. There is no problem in Chrome or Opera, but only Nightly is the problem.

I didn't even have to reinstall and I don't know what to do. I might try installing the old version, but I don't know where to get it.

In other words, it seems that it runs without problems when it is first started. But after running If you repeat creating 10 new tabs several times, it becomes slower and stops responding.

It's as if the capacity is full and you can't take it anymore... however, my hard disk has 200 GB of free space.

If this problem is not resolved, I don't think I can use Nightly anymore.

Error message

설명: 

 오류로 인해 이 프로그램이 Windows와 상호 작용하지 않습니다.

문제 서명: 

 문제 이벤트 이름:	AppHangB1  응용 프로그램 이름:	firefox.exe  응용 프로그램 버전:	88.0.0.7728  응용 프로그램 타임스탬프:	603acfd6  중단 서명:	9c0e  중단 유형:	0  OS 버전:	6.1.7601.2.1.0.256.1  로캘 ID:	1042  추가 정지 서명 1:	9c0ebfe75cb0efa66b21762d6b9e2733  추가 정지 서명 2:	a774  추가 정지 서명 3:	a7742fb7cef8ff4e7802a3ccd85b4c6e  추가 정지 서명 4:	9c0e  추가 정지 서명 5:	9c0ebfe75cb0efa66b21762d6b9e2733  추가 정지 서명 6:	a774  추가 정지 서명 7:	a7742fb7cef8ff4e7802a3ccd85b4c6e


I don't know if the meaning is well conveyed using Google Translate. Anyway, I hope for help.

title: Burned By An Update To 86.0!
content:
Hello,

Just updated after a long time from 66.0.5 -> 72.0.2 -> 86.0. This is what FF wanted to do for some unexplained reason so I just let it.

Now when I open a new tab in an open window I get a white screen and nothing works. Entering a URL in the bar or pressing any of the buttons like home does nothing whatsoever. Just a blank white screen.

This is why I LOATHE updating anything! The odds of breaking something that was working perfectly is VERY high. Proved the point once again. I used to let FF update itself and then got burned by the Quantum update that trashed ALL of my open session windows. Turned auto-update OFF after that so that could manually grab and save a copy of the profile BEFORE any update happens.

So how do I fix this or is it a legitimate BUG that should be reported (and how to do same)?

Thanks, Steve
creator: Steve_Sr.

title: opening new browser in new profile
content: I've been trying for some time to determine why my main Firefox profile, the profile I use most of the time, has a lot of trouble when I use Google Street View. The Street View screen essentially freezes when I try and use it. But, taking a tip from Firefox help I opened up a new profile in a new browser. When doing so, the existing Google Street View problem disappeared completely in the new browser. I call my new profile in the new browser my second Firefox browser to use. My question is, can someone explain why the problem disappears in my second Firefox browser? Looking at the options window when I open the Firefox menu, I see a few differences between the two browsers. The big difference is the second browser has much less applications in it. It has 7 applications where as my first browser has 21 applications. Is this the possible reason why the second browser doesn't have the problem that my first browser does? If so, how can I delete some of the applications in the first browser to see if that is the problem? I'm trying NOT to refresh my first Firefox browser as refreshing Firefox caused much problems for me in the past. And, it seems some Firefox aficionado's do say use caution when using a refresh. So, can someone please explain why the one browser, the new second browser, is void of the problem that plaques my first or original Firefox browser? Thank you.
